<Text: The Old Melbourne Gaol is a museum on Russell Street, in Melbourne, Victoria, Australia.>

<Text: Old Melbourne Gaol:  It was first constructed starting in 1839, and during its operation as a prison between 1842 and 1929, it held and executed some of Australia's most notorious criminals, including bushranger Ned Kelly and serial killer Frederick Bailey Deeming.>

<Old Melbourne Gaol
3:
--------------------
<Text: Old Melbourne Gaol:  In total, 133 people were executed by hanging.>

4:
--------------------
Text: Old Melbourne Gaol:  Though it was used briefly during World War II, it formally ceased operating as a prison in 1924; with parts of the gaol being incorporated into the RMIT University, and the rest becoming a museum.
